page.title: 14Mr T**** (continued)
page.content: He is quite scornful of{"this jogging {rubbish"}implying that it's just a fleeting fashion,that won't bring real benefit to its practicioners.He is also amused by people who move into older houses and then procede to rip them apart and "do them up",he is horrified by local house prices.He is pleased that his local church,the Methodist chapel is still doing well, with a number of young people attending. Like many other local people he is slightly worried by the influx of immigrants, the local Mini-market has just been taken over by an Asian family.But it's not their colour that worries him.As he says,there was a big influx of Polish refugees after the war, and they have integrated well. No,for Mr T**** it's getting used to the new faces that he finds difficult.
